-- Noir --

Noir stares at the sensory display of the Rogue Star, the glances at 
Gatara and the console. The Rogues' initial mission had been a 
failure... The black assassin/tech didn't like failure, regardless 
of the fact that there were circumstances beyond her control.

"Failure..." She frowns, "Should I go and meet Devilcat and the 
others?" Her words were now mostly directed to herself, but she also 
expected Gatara to have an opinion. 

"Has Devilcat given you a status report?" She keeps talking, 
possibly interrupting Gatara, "Ahh, maybe not, was he out of sensor 
range?"


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Gatara::
> 
> "We were chasing a small shuttlecraft that passed too close to 
where 
> we were working.  That operation is now lost to us, as Rogue Star 
got 
> caught in a space-time rip and flung to Earth's distant past."  
> Gatara turns to the console nearest her, and examines the read-
out.  
> "We were in the process of repairing the ship when Jayde's 
scouting 
> mission went awry.  Devilcat, Riekan, and Torin went to rescue 
her - 
> we're keeping watch here.  Everyone else is in stasis lock because 
of 
> the energy storm that sent us down."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > -- Noir --
> > 
> > Noir's optics focus on Gatara, and she nods her aknowledgement 
at 
> > the bot. The rather large Rogue named Gatara was known to her, 
and 
> > her memories to be a formidable ally, and not one to be trifled 
> with.
> > 
> > "Some living, some are already dead." She pauses, the continues 
> > before Gatara can say anything, "Where is Devilcat, and what is 
the 
> > Rogues current situation on wherever it is we have landed. 
> > Unfortunately my memory has a few blanks still, and I can not 
> > remember our final destination."
